solution_line_template: In the second week, {initial_sales_week1} x {multiplier} = <<{initial_sales_week1}*{multiplier}={sales_week2}>>{sales_week2} bags of chips were sold.
So there was a total of {sales_week2} + {initial_sales_week1} = <<{sales_week2}+{initial_sales_week1}={total_sales_week1_2}>>{total_sales_week1_2} bags of chips sold on the first and second week.

Thus, a total of {total_sales_month} - {total_sales_week1_2} = <<{total_sales_month}-{total_sales_week1_2}={remaining_sales_week3_4}>>{remaining_sales_week3_4} bags of chips were sold on the third and fourth week.

Therefore, {remaining_sales_week3_4}/{num_weeks_equal_sales} = <<{remaining_sales_week3_4}/{num_weeks_equal_sales}={sales_per_week_3_4}>>{sales_per_week_3_4} bags of chips were each sold on the third and fourth week.
